This loan will enable them to better meet customer demand and increase their profits. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 33 year-old businesswoman who is married to Isaac, also a businessman.  They are blessed with one child. She has been running a greengrocery business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,500 which she uses to support her family’s needs.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Janet will use the loan to buy more stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business. With the anticipated profits from the business, she plans to save to be able to educate her child. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29 year-old businessman who is married to Mwikali,  a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 4 and 3 years respectively. John has been in a welding business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. John will use the loan to buy more metal rods for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. 

His dream is to soon be able to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy metal rods for his business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sta. Sonia, es de ciudad del Este, ella es soltera vive aun con sus padres. Tiene un pequeño negocio donde realiza recarga de líneas telefónicas, fotocopias y venta de algunos artículos de primera necesidad, como ser fideos, arroz, azúcar, panificados y demás.
Nos cuenta que consiguió montar su negocio con un pequeño crédito que le había otorgado la fundación y ella hizo trabajar el capital y de esa forma fue creciendo. Hoy día ella ha aumentado sus ingresos personales y de esa forma también ayuda en los gastos del hogar a sus padres.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y en vistas a ese sueño es que solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser fideo, azúcar, yerba, panificados y demás.  Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
Sonia is from the Ciudad del Este.  She is single and still lives with her parents.  She has a small business where she recharges telephone lines, makes photocopies, and sells some basic needs items like noodles, rice, sugar, baked goods, and more.

She tells us that she succeeded in setting up her business with a small loan that the Fundación had granted her.  She made the capital work, and the business was growing.  She has now increased her personal income, and this is how she also helps her parents with the household expenses.

She is a very tenacious and honest person.  She is known and cherished by the people who live in this neighborhood.  Her goal is to be able to continue growning.

In light of this dream, she is requesting a loan to buy staple items like noodles, sugar, herbs, baked goods, and more.  She is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her.

loans.use: Comprar fideo, azúcar, yerba, panificados y demás

loans.name: La Cle De David Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA CLE DE DAVID est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sophie Akouavi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sophie Akouavi est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophie Akouavi a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Sophie Akouavi vend de l’huile de palme et du pétrole dans un marché du Bénin. Sophie Akouavi achète ses produits dans le même marché au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sophie Akouavi désire obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA CLE DE DAVID. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
LA CLE DE DAVID Group  is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Sophie Akouavi, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Sophie Akouavi is 33 years old and married to a driver named Michel. The couple has four school-attending children to support. Sophie Akouavi dropped out of elementary school. For about twenty years, she's been selling palm oil and fuel in one of Benin's market.

She gets her supplies from the same market. In order to bolster her stocks and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil and fuel

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald has owned and managed his corn fields for almost nine years. He is 26 years old, married to Marilyn, and blessed with two children. He is very happy to have children because they serve as his inspiration to work. Despite the hardships and difficulties he faces in cultivating his farm land, he is lucky because he has enough strength to work hard in the field to support the needs and wants of his family.
Ronald is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for his business. He will use it to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to make his corn field more productive. He hopes to increase his profit to save for his children's future and lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 21 year-old businessman.  He is single, and he has been running an electronic shop for the past year with a monthly income of KES 8,000,  which he uses to fulfill his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Timothy will use the loan to buy electrical parts and to stock more electronic items (iron boxes, radios, TVs) for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will save to have more capital to be able to expand his business. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy electrical spare parts and other electronics for his business

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.ru: Эгамберди проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его сын работает строителем. Сам Эгамберды выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Egamberdi lives in the Yavan district.  He is 41 years old, married and has three children.  His son is a construction worker.  Egamberdi grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is a widow with four children ages 15 to 27 years old.  Three of the children are attending college and living on their own, while the youngest one is in school and living at home. 

Bindu has been selling necklaces and earrings for the past ten years.  She started this business with money given to her by her brothers and she learned the business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (necklaces and earrings) for her business.  In the future she want to educate all her children through the college level.

loans.use: to purchase more necklaces and earrings for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 25 years old, is married.  She has a daughter and a son who are six months old and three years old. For the last four years, she has been selling tomatoes, potatoes, pawpaws, bananas and peas to hotels and residents. Her business challenge is insufficient funds to add the stock of fruit and vegetables. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaw. In the future, Jane hopes to be selling vegetables and fruits at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes and pawpaws.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean fait le commerce des habits en détail.  Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 2 à 11 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter continuellement son capital en fin de satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra d’être grossiste dans les années à venir.
 Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean is a clothing outfit retailer. He is 31 years old and is married with 3 children, aged from 2 to 11, two of whom are in school. He completed 6 years of primary education. This is his third successive loan with ACB. He will use this loan to increase the stock of his clothing outfit business. His strategy for growing the business is to continually add to the stock in order to meet all the needs of his customers. This will allow him to become a wholesaler in the years to come. With the profits, he plans to educate his children in school.

loans.use: to increase the stock in his business selling outfits

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married man, the father of six children. He has worked as a car mechanic for 35 years.  This long experience gave him customers' trust and support. He opened his current garage in 1997, and it is well known in the region.

Ali works hard for his family's happiness, he sacrifices his life for theirs. To provide his children with the best education, Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for their school fees.

This is Ali's second experience with Al Majmoua, and his previous one was very impressive, it reflected positively on both his social and financial situations. 

Ali is looking forward to improving and updating his business as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente grupo fue gracias a una de las miembros, que invitó a sus amigas y vecinas a formar el grupo, en busca de un bien para todas ellas. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres, muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, quienes están trabajando en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Yanina, quien trabaja todos los días para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesiten, para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Ella se dedica a la venta de variadas prendas, su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para abastecerse con prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener un buen stock de prendas para cuando su cliente se las pida.
texts.en:
The formation of this group was thanks to one of the members who invited her friends and neighbors to form the group, in search of good for them all. Currently this group has 17 women, very hard workers and fighters, who are working in their 2nd cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation.

One of the members is Yanina who works every day to give her family everything that they need so that they do not lack anything. She works selling various kinds of garments. Her desire is to be able to continue growing so that she will have more income in order to continue helping her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to stock the business with summer outfits as it is going to be hot soon and she wants to have a good stock of clothing when her clients make a request.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает  пятерых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Назгул начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 12,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков на откорм. Доходы Назгул планирует вложить в постройку нового удобного сарая для скота, и в будущем – в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nazgul is 35 years old, married and is raising five children.  In search of a source for financial support for her family, she started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock ten years ago, using an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, Nazgul's business currently yields about 8,000 som per month from sale of milk and meat products.  In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up.  Nazgul plans to invest the profits from this loan into building a new, comfortable barn for the livestock, and, in the future, further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dehlia

texts.en:
Dehlia is 36 years of age. She is married with three children. She is a farmer's wife who helps her husband in operating their farming business. She plants corn and cultivates the farm land to make it more productive. Dehlia has been in farming for five years and currently provides sacks of corn in their market every cropping season. 
Dehlia has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to improve their farming business. She hopes to increase her crops and provide more sacks of corn every cropping season. In this way, she will be able to earn a higher income to better their lives and save for her children's studies as well.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 47-year-old married lady living with her husband and their five children. She started her business 25 years ago at her home where she makes accessories and embroiders oriental dresses by hand to help her husband with the expenses of their household.

Being so popular among her family members, neighbors, and friends who like what she creates, Sahar decided to take a big step four years ago by starting her own dependent shop for accessories and handmade embroidery.

She would like to get a loan to help her expand her store, buy more raw materials, and display a new variety of products as she is now a productive member of the family and helps greatly with the household and the children’s expenses.

Because Sahar is a conservative person, she has asked her son Bara to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to help her expand her store, buy more raw materials, and display a new variety of products

loans.name: Hamideh

texts.en:
Hamideh is a 23-year-old Lebanese woman. She is engaged to be married.  She lives with her sole parent and with three siblings, two of whom are working. She cooperates with her two siblings to cover the family's expenses.

Hamideh has been working as a tailor for the past seven years from her home.  She’s well known as a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers all over her village. Today, she’s looking to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and many others.  This Kiva loan will boost her productivity, and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own evening-dress shop and expand her business outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock in her clothing retail business

loans.name: Telesia Mwende

texts.en:
Telesia, 42 years old, is married and has five children ranging from 6 to 21 years of age. She describes herself as a talkative and social woman.

For the last six years, she has been involved in greengrocery activity. She sells cabbages, tomatoes, bananas and mangoes. In addition, she sells maize and green peas sometimes to increase her source of income. Telesia is facing a challenge of insufficient funds in her business. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cabbages and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbage and potatoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora María, quien por medio de la venta de cosméticos logra tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Nos comenta que tiene buena venta debido a la variedad que siempre tiene, sumado a eso el buen precio y la amabilidad con que ella atiende a sus clientes. Desea poder seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Desea comprar maquillajes de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad y de esa forma atraer a más clientas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Nineteen women in the Ciudad del Este have united with the purpose of working together and through this work getting ahead and helping one another. They are hard working women and fighters, and are in the eighth cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguayan (Paraguayan Foundation).

One of the members is María, who by selling cosmetics succeeds by having the financial means necessary in order to be able to help her family. She comments to us that she has good sales because of the variety she always has, in addition to the good price and the friendliness with which she assists her customers. She wants to be able to continue growing her business, and this is why she is asking for a loan.

She wants to buy all types of makeup, with which she could have more variety and therefore attract more clients. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline  fait le commerce des habits en détail. Elle a 41 ans et elle est veuve et a 2 enfants de 13 à 17 ans, qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a une autre personne en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de diversifier les sortes des habits qu’elle vend. Elle veut devenir grossiste dans le futur.
 Avec les profits, elle va payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Pauline is a clothing retailer.  She is 41 years old and a widow. She has two children ages 13 and 17 who both attend school. She also has one other dependent.  She completed 6 years of primary education. This is her second loan with ACB.  She will use her loan to increase the working capital of her clothing business.  Her strategy for growing her business is to diversify the kinds of clothes she sells. She wants to become a wholesaler in the future. With the profits, she will pay her children's school fees and build a house.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her clothing business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 56-year-old businessman and he is married to Pauline.  The couple is blessed with six children. 

Julius has been operating a bicycle transportation business as his primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Julius will use the loan to service his bike and to buy more stock of sugar and rice for his retail shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loans.use: To service his bike and buy more sugar and rice for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more home products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is single with two children who are 6 and 12 years old. They are attending school and live at home. 

Florence has been selling used clothing for the past 15 years. She says sometimes customer response to her business is slow. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business.

In the future she wants to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 31-year-old single businessman. He has been running a barber shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Isaac will use the loan to buy a shaving machine for his business. With the anticipated profits from the business he plans to expand his business. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the future.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine for his business

loans.name: Goboza1 Group

texts.en:
This is Lindiwe, a 35-year-old married woman with three children aged 11, 9 and 5 years old. Two of her children are still at school. She does not have other dependents who live with her. 
Lindiwe is in the business of photocopying in Masvingo town. She has been in the business for two years and has no employees. Lindiwe has requested a loan of $250 to buy stationery for use in her photocopying business. She buys these products in Masvingo town. With the income from the business she will be able to finish building her house in order to have a better shelter. Lindiwe says the business challenges she faces are high competition and the fact that some of her machines are not new and therefore need quite a bit of attention every now and then. She is planning on owning her own stationery shop in the Central Business District.

loans.use: to buy another printer and bond paper.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Mercy who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Geoffrey will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business for the education of his child. 

He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Sr. Edgar es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Aida de 31 años de edad, ellos tienen 3 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios primarios.
Don Edgar es carpintero, desde hace 2 años, el comenzó como empleado por mucho tiempo, tiempo que le sirvió para aprender el oficio,  para que luego vaya juntando su capital y poder hacerse de un negocio propio, así lo hizo, en la actualidad Él fabrica muebles de todo tipo, para el señor donde trabajaba anteriormente.
Comenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo, para tener un poco más de ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia, y darle a sus hijos una buena educación.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar mas madera, para asi tener buen stock de productos terminados y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mr. Edgar, 36, is from the city of Caaguazú city, and is married to Mrs. Aida, 31 years old.  They have 3 children who are enrolled in primary school. Don Edgar is a carpenter for 2 years now, he started as an employee for a long time, which helped him learn the craft, then go along with to take his capital and start his own business.  He did it and manufactures furniture of any kind, for the man where he previously worked. He says his dream is to continue to grow, to have a little more income and thus help his family, and give his children a good education. He is requesting this loan to buy more wood, so that he has good stock of finished goods and to meet customer orders.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Ra'eda

texts.en:
Ra'eda is a 37-year-old woman and a mother of three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works in agriculture to increase his income. 
Ra'eda wants to help her husband in paying for some necessary repairs to the family's vehicle, which they use for daily transport, such as changing the vehicle engine, changing the doors, painting, etc. Therefore, she needs to take a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN. This loan will enable Ra'eda to help her husband pay for vehicle repairs. This will increase the vehicle's efficiency and provide the family with comfortable conditions when travelling in the vehicle. Ra'eda is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to the family vehicle.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 46 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is a widow with two children aged 7 and 9 who are in school and live at home. Hawa has been selling rice, red oil, bitter ball (an  eggplant-like vegetable), etc., for the past 12 years. She started this business with money given to her by her sisters and she learned this business from her mother. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, and bitter ball and many other items for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, bitter ball, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, medicines and stock feeds.

loans.name: Omu

texts.en:
Omu is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with four children aged 15 to 22 years old who are in school and live at home. Omu has been selling rice, oil, peanuts, butter, and onions for the past 25 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.en:
The first Kiva loan helped Karamatkan to purchase cattle. Today she has a farm with six cows, six heifers, two bull-calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month. 

Now, Karamatkan plans to broaden her business activities by land-cultivating. For this reason she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 60,000 KGS to  purchase seeds of tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a heifer and a goat

loans.name: Sharon Atieno

texts.en: Sharon is a widow and has three children ranging from two to seven years old. She is a polite and hardworking woman. For the last four years, she has been selling second-had clothes to frequent customers. Previously, she was involved in green grocery activity. She has a challenge of financial constraints in her business. She will be using the loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more clothes for selling. Sharon hopes and dreams to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 31-year-old businessman married to Caroline who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 18,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Gabriel will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the harvest on his farm, he plans to save money towards the education of his children. 

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 56-year-old business lady married to Mulondu who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children aged 25, 19, 16, 13 and 9 years old, respectively. She has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy more livestock for selling. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Fanseyni

texts.fr:
fanseyni habite dans la région du sud au sénégal.Agée de 49 ans divorcée depuis 1995.Elle 4 anfants qui sont tous à l'école et sont aussi a ses charges .Avec ce crédit,elle achate de la marchandise pour augmenter le stock de sa boutique,elle sa journée de 07h à 23h.
Fanseyni a démarré son commerce depuis 1995 au moment de sa divorce.Elle a démarreé son commerce avec un petit fonds sur une table pour étre là ou elle est.Avec son commerce,elle assure la nouriture de la famille et les frais scolaire ses enfants.
Fanseyni a comme objectif:étre une grande commerçante et avoir un grand magasin et sa propre maison dans l'avenir
texts.en: Fanseyni lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is 49 years old and has been divorced since 1995. She has 4 children who live with her and all attend school. With this loan she will buy merchandise to increase the stock in her shop. Her day runs from 7am until 11pm. Fanseyni started her business in 1995 at the time of her divorce. She started her business with a small stock - on a table in order to be close to home. With her business, she is able to feed the family and pay the childrens' school fees. Fanseyni's goal: To be a successful shopkeeper and to have a big shop and her own house in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem, who is a 25-year-old young man, is a father of one son. He is a taxi driver with a low income. He wants to purchase new living room seats to provide comfortable conditions for his family. Ibraheem needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay for the furniture. When he gets the loan, he will be able to purchase new living room seats and this will offer to the family better home conditions. Ibraheem appears in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase new living room seats.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man from the Western part of Kenya. He is married to Scholastica with whom he has two children.

Peter operates a barber shop and he has been doing this kind of business for the last year. 

He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase two more shaving machines. He will use his anticipated profits to plow back into his barber business. He seems qualified for continuous loaning, even in the future.

He desires to open more barber shops within his town.

loans.use: to purchase two more shaving machines

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Cayetano están en el septimo Ciclo con 10 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que trabajan día a día por conseguir sus objetivos.
Una de las miembros es la señora Zulma, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, por medio de su trabajo y gracias a su simpatía y buena venta ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con mucho sacrificio. Una de sus metas es tener una tienda grande en la cual pueda tener una buena cantidad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para poder abastecerse. Agradece esta oportunidad que se le da, pues es muy importante para ella.
texts.en: The committee called San Cayetano is in the seventh cycle with 10 members.  It is a group in the neighborhood that is close knit, caring and responsible.  The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit, working every day to achieve their objectives. One of the members is Mrs. Zulma, who tells us that she sells clothes through her work and thanks to their pleasantness and good sales, has been able to bring up her family with great sacrifice. One of her goals is to have a big store in which to have a good amount of clothing to offer her customers. She enlists the help of the foundation and KIVA to buy clothing of all kinds, to stock up. She is grateful for this opportunity that is it given as it is very important to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ink and photo paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Khairulla

texts.ru: Хайрулла  - молодой фермер, живущий на юге Кыргызстана. Он – единственный сын в семье, который согласно кыргызским традициям, живет со своими родителями и заботится о них. Основным источником дохода для семьи Хайруллы является животноводство. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Хайруллы, его хозяйство  сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Хайрулла обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку трех бычков для откорма и перепродажи. В бизнес – планах Хайруллы - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в личных – в ближайшее время обзавестись собственной семьей.
texts.en:
Khairulla is a young farmer located in south Kyrgyzstan. He's the only male child in the family, therefore, according to Kyrgyz tradition, he lives with and supports his parents. Their main source of income is animal husbandry. Thanks to Khairulla's dedication and tenacity, his farmstead bring in about 10,000 soms (KGS) per month via the sales of milk and meat products. 

In order to increase the herd, Khairulla turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners", requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three bulls for subsequent fattening and sale.

Khairulla's business plans for the near future consist of investing in his farmstead and increasing his herd, while his personal goals are to get married and raise a family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers and a spray pump

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de la fundación paraguaya. Están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación.
Miguela es una de esas mujeres, comenta que ella trabaja mucho y que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues en estos tiempos las personas prefieren este tipo de prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para venderlas otra vez. Ella está agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Curuguaty have teamed up with the goal of working together and thus helping each other.  They are currently in the second cycle of the foundation program in Paraguay. They are learning the importance of teamwork within a group with responsibility, honesty and communication.
Miguela is one of those women, who says she works hard and likes what she does selling second-hand clothes. She says that she's doing very well, because these days people prefer this type of clothing.  She is requesting this credit to purchase clothing to sell again. She is grateful for the opportunity the foundation and KIVA give her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Javanshir

texts.en: Javanshir is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in a small village in the Imishli region with his wife and three children. He breeds sheep and cattle and has 15 years of experience in this field. During these years, Javanshir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. He purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. Sheep raising takes about 3-4 months and cattle breeding takes 5-6 months. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profit in the Imishli livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. His business requires a lot of physical strength and Javanshir spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. Javanshir's monthly income is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) and Javanshir wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, Javanshir needs more capital to put into his business to cover the market. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will use the loan to buy 10 sheep, two cattle and one cow. He has already demonstrated himself to be a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 30-year-old young man, and he is a father to two sons and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and his wife works tailoring clothes and has a low income. Adnan wants to change the old refrigerator at home and purchase a new one to preserve the food the family eats in better and healthy conditions, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay. When Adnan gets the loan, he will be able to purchase a new refrigerator for his home and offer a better standard of living to the family. Adnan is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new home refrigerator.

loans.name: Sayyab

texts.en:
Sayyab is a 57-year-old man who lives and works in the small village in the Imishli region. Sayyab is married and has four children. He owns a small café where he serves local people national dishes and tea. Tea is the most popular beverage in Azerbaijan and people like to sit for hours and drink tea with homemade jam. He has 10 years of experience in the service business, however he opened his café just two years ago. 

Sayyab`s son helps him to run the business and serve clients. Being polite and friendly helps Sayyab to provide the best quality service to his clients. In the evenings, his café is full because that is the time when local men join together to chat over a couple kettles of tea. 

The monthly profit from Sayyab`s business is 300 AZN. He would like to expand his business, and for this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will use the loan to make renovations and purchase new chairs, tables, and tableware. This will be his second loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to make renovations and purchase new chairs, tables, and tableware for his cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more, diverse food products and beverages

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son 20 mujeres quienes tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ven una gran ayuda en el programa de la fundación paraguaya, es por ello que se unieron y de allí surge el grupo llamado el progreso, su deseo es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa y poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo social.ç
La sra. Irene  es vendedora de Artículos de Limpieza, tiene 3 hijos que van al colegio y tiene su pareja desde hace varios años, ambos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que su marido también la ayuda en la venta de los productos que vende, y de esa forma es un poco más ligero el trabajo. Su deseo es extenderse y tener más clientela y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los químicos que necesita para la elaboración de los productos de limpieza que vende, como ser: colorantes, esencias, bactericidas, soda caustica y demás insumos necesarios. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da a ella y sus compañeras.
texts.en: This group is from the city of Villa Elisa; there are 20 women who are keen to move forward and see a great help in the Paraguayan Foundation program, which is why they joined and then emerged the group called progress.  Their desire is to reach the maximum level of the program and to grow not only economically, but also socially.  Mrs. Irene is selling cleaning Products, she has 3 children going to school and has a relationship for several years, both work and help with household expenses. She says her husband also helps in selling the products she sells, and thus it is a little lighter work. Her desire is to expand and have more customers and thus have a better income to continue to help her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of chemicals needed for the production of cleaning products they sell, such as: colors, scents, bactericides, caustic soda and other necessary inputs. Thanks to the foundation for this opportunity of progress that it gives her and her companions.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to make homemade cleaning products.

loans.name: Lena Nzasu

texts.en: Lena is 26 years old and is married to a teacher.  They have a son and a daughter, aged one and three. Lena is an ambitious woman. She runs a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions and kales.  She has been in this business for the last four years. Her business challenge is insufficient funds. She hopes by using this loan of KES 10,000, she will be able to improve her grocery store business. Lena's hope and dream in the next five years is to be a supplier of potatoes and tomatoes in the nearby town.

loans.use: buy potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,tambien se dedica a cocinar platos como estofado de pollo,pollo al horno,saltado (es un plato a base de carne frita con papas fritas) entre otros platos,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma keeps on engaging in her meals selling activity. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner meals, and she also cooks dishes such as chicken stew, baked chicken, strip steak (fried meat with french fries) and more. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children. Her dream is to expand and improve her meals selling activity. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguela es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es separada, tiene hijos, pero todos ya mayores. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas (alimento típico paraguayo) desde hace mas de 20 años, comenta que gracias a este trabajo pudo darle todo lo que necesitaba su familia.
Siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y pese a los años que ya lleva en el negocio, siempre disfruta de lo que hace. Desea seguir trabajando y creciendo, por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo por eso.
solicita a la fundación y Kiva un crédito para la compra de materia prima para chipa en cantidades,como ser almidón, manteca, huevos, condimentos y demás, y así obtiene mejores precios y le sobra más ganancias de su productos.
texts.en:
Miguela comes from the town of Caacupé. She is separated from her husband and she has adult children. She has been engaged in preparing “chipas” (a typical Paraguayan food) for more than 20 years, and she says that thanks to this activity she has been able to provide for her family giving them all they needed.
She has always been a very hard-working and resourceful woman, and in spite of the years she has dedicated to her activity, she always enjoys what she does. She wants to keep on working and improving, and for this reason she always seriously engages in it.
She is requesting a loan to the institution and to Kiva to buy big quantities of basic ingredients for the chipas such as starch, butter, eggs, flavorings among others: this way she will sell at better prices and she will earn more from the selling of her products.

loans.use: To buy starch, butter, eggs, flavorings and other ingredients to prepare "chipas".

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El socio Ronald se sigue al negocio de venta de ceviche,el tiene locales donde vende ceviche,el socio atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar los locales donde vende ceviche.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para el ceviche como pescado,limon,camote y lechuga al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ronald keeps on selling (marinated seafood cocktails). He sells ceviche in leased locales. He works form 8 am to 6 pm, and thanks to this activity he is able to provide for his children. He dreams of expanding and improving the locales where he sells ceviche. He is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for ceviche such as fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price to prepare ceviche.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is 31 years old market vendor.  He is single and lives with his parents. He sells detergents products for last 6 years.  Emin is very polite and friendly person and that’s why his sales is increasing every months.  His father helps him to sell products.  His shop is in the central bazaar, the most popular vending place, always full of customers. 

The income business brings 230 AZN per month. Emin would like to increase his income via purchasing more merchandise and increase his sales. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase  more merchandise

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Ms Xuan is the mother of  Minh, who is a student.  Minh was born in 1993.  She is studying accounting at the University.  Her study duration lasts 36  months.  She is a first year student.  To be an accountant is her dream job, and she is trying to study hard to absorb knowledge since she wants to be self-confident in her new career.  She hopes she will get a good job after graduation. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnamese Dongs to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: pay tuition fees

loans.name: Pethis

texts.en:
Pethis is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with four children between 4 and 7 years old; they are in school and live at home. 

Pethis has been involved in the used clothes business for the past two years. She says her main challenge is a transportation problem. She started this business with money received from her friend. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit and makes her popular. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to achieve higher education and lift her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tecoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Este grupo se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo, todas las mujeres son trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas.
una de las miembros es la señora Patricia, quien nos comenta que se dedica al reciclaje, este es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que ella tiene que recorrer por las cales buscando productos que sean reciclables. Ella está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto y gracias a esto puede dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales reciclables en cantidad, para que de esa forma revenda y tenga un poco más de ganancias. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se les da.
texts.en: Fourteen women from the city of Asuncion have joined with the goal of helping each other by working together. This group is in the fourth cycle; all women are working, struggling and living hard lives.  One of the members is Mrs. Patricia, who tells us that she sells recycling, this is very hard work, and she has to go traveling the streets looking for products that are recyclable. She is very proud of what she does, it is a decent and honest job and because of this she can give her family everything they need.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of recyclable materials in quantity, to resell and have a little more profit. She is thankful for the opportunity given to them.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy more food to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Vera Cristina

texts.es:
Vera Cristina es una señora de 50 años de edad, que trabajo como asalariada durante 18 años como empleada comercial ; hace dos años se le presenta la oportunidad de convertirse en emprendedora cuando la dueña de la tienda donde ha laborado tantos años, decide dejar la actividad del comercio y pone a la venta el derecho comercial, Vera Cristina sigue todavia como empleada mientas aparece alguien interesada en adquirirla, un día que se encontraba limpiando los muebles del negocio le pide a Dios, que si este negocio es para ella, le ponga a la persona que pueda apoyarla financieramente para tener el capital inicial y comenzar ya ella como dueña, aparece esta persona y le ofrece prestarle $ 1,000.00 y alli comienza una actividad comercial sobre la que se tenia experiencia ya que la habia administrado durante tantos años.
Se da cuenta que existe Fundación Mujer, y decide tramitar un préstamo para capital de trabajo, esto le permite generar mas ventas y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida; es así como recurre nuevamente a Fundación Mujer solicitando apoyo financiero, para reforzar su capital de trabajo, con la compra de mas mercaderia(camisetas,jeans y camisas) y aprovechar la epoca de las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, y ofrecer una mayor variedad de los articulos que ella comercializa.
El deseo de Vera Cristina es tener los recursos a futuro, que le permitan poder tener una casa propia ya que en este momento la comparte con su hijo, y es conciente que este tiene el derecho de hacer su vida tambien.
texts.en: Vera Cristina is a 50-year-old woman who worked for 18 years as a salaried employee. Two years ago the opportunity arose for her to become a businesswoman when the owner of the store where she worked for so many years decided to give up the activity and put the business up for sale. Vera Christina continued working as an employee while it appeared someone was interested in buying the business. One day while she was cleaning the store's furniture, she asked God if the business was for her. She found a person who could support her financially with the initial capital so she could become the owner. This person offered to loan her the money, and she took over the business she already knew how to administer from her years of experience. She became aware of Kiva partner Fundación Mujer and decided to apply for a loan to give her more working capital so she could generate more sales and in turn improve her quality of life. She turns once again to Fundación Mujer, requesting financial support to strengthen her cash flow so she can purchase more merchandise (shirts, T-shirts, jeans) and take advantage of Christmas time and New Year's by offering a wider variety of products. Her dream is to have the resources in the future to be able to have her own home since she currently shares one with her son and she knows he has the right to live his own life, too.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, T-shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 55 años de edad, vive con la señora Amelia de 54 años de edad, viven en la ciudad de Itá, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo la menor vive con ellos, los demás ya son todos independientes.
El señor Mario tiene una despensa en su domicilio hace mas de 10 años, allí surte a vecinos y a ocasionales con todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar tales como, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, bebidas en gral., carbón y otros productos. Comenta que su esposa le ayuda en el negocio. El quiere seguir creciendo para poder continuar manteniendo su casa.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, yerba, carbón, bebidas en gral. y otros insumos con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mario is 55 years old, he lives with Amelia, aged 54, in the town of Itá and they have 5 children: only the youngest daughter lives with them, while the other children are all economically independent.
Mario has been running a small store in his house for more than 10 years, where he sells every kind of basic necessities for the house such as sugar, yerba maté, dairy products, drinks, carbon and so on to his neighbors and to occasional customers. He says that his wife helps him in the shop. He wants to keep on growing in order to keep on providing for this family.
He is requesting a loan to buy sugar, yerba maté, carbon, drinks and other products to supply his shop and to have a wider variety of products to offer to his customers.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba maté, carbon, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis, tiene 40 años, esta casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 19 años, tienen 3 hijos todos ellos varones, Walter, Juan y Jorge, los tres chicos se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Luis anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leche y tenía una carnicería, luego comenzó a interesarse por la Veterinaria y empezó a estudiar hasta que se recibió de Dr. Veterinario, desde esa vez, hace 4 años que posee su Agro-Veterinaria donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa, actualmente posee su local en su domicilio. Gracias a la buena atención que brinda ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre acude a el.
Solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para comprar vitaminas, vacunas, alimentos para animales, etc. lo cual el vende en su agroveterinaria. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Luis is 40 years old and has been married to Sonia for 19 years. They have three sons who are in school, Walter, Juan and Jorge. Luis previously made a living selling milk and had a butcher shop. He started to become interested in veterinary medicine and started studying until he received his doctorate. Since that time he has had his veterinary office for about four years and works alongside his wife. He currently runs his office out of his home. Thanks to the good service he provides he already has a good customer base that always comes to him. He is requesting the help of Kiva and partner Fundación Paraguaya to help him purchase vitamins, vaccines, animal feed and other items to sell at his veterinary office. He is grateful for this opportunity because the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines, animal feed, etc.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Señora Nélida es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia. Nos cuenta que tiene un taller de Corte y Confección donde realiza trabajos de alta costura como trajecitos,  Vestidos, Camisas y otros.
Comenta que el taller que tiene lo heredo de su mamá y que gracias al esfuerzo que ella le pone ha podido crecer y hacerse de una clientela considerable. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien no le teme a ningún desafío ni trabajo, y lo ha demostrado levantando en negocio que tiene.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, gomas y botones, los cuales son indispensables para ella, ya que son los insumos que utiliza en su taller. Está mu agradecida por la ayuda que le dan kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en: Nélida is from the city of Villarrica, Paraguay. She is 51 years old, married and lives in her own home. She says that she has a sewing shop where she does haute couture like suits, dresses, shirts and other items. She says that she inherited the shop from her mother, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to grow it and have a considerable customer base. She defines herself as a hard-working and enterprising woman who isn't afraid of any challenge or task, and she has demonstrated that with her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, rubber and buttons, which are indispensable items for her workshop. She is very grateful for the support from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, rubber and buttons.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 11 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, cebada y papas como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Las compras lo hace en San Miguel y las ventas lo hace a cualquier comerciante.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura y comprar  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito ha podido comprar los abonos sin ningún problema.

 El sueño es poder comprar terrenos para sembrar y tener una casa para poder vivir con la familia.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es en las temporadas de año que existe variedad del clima y esto produce la lancha a los cultivos y por eso se dañan.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children.  He lives with his wife and his children ages 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 and 11 in the province of San Miguel de Bolívar.

The VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico, having the name of the community, is found 20 minutes from the canton of San Miguel and they work in agriculture as the source of family income.

Jorge works in agriculture, planting corn, wheat, barley, and potatos as the source of income for his family.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales in various markets.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and solutions for agriculture.  With the aid of the loan, he has been able to purchase the compost without any problems.

His dream is to be able to purchase fields to plant and to have a house so he can live with his family.

The challenges that he has faced come in the seasons of the year when the weather varies and this produces the late blight, thus damaging the crops.

In his free time, he enjoys the festivals of the Divine Child.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and other solutions used for farming.

loans.name: Gloria Rosmira

texts.es: La señora Gloria trabajó por varios años en una empresa, la cual hace poco fue liquidada y con este acontecimiento la señora Gloria quedo sin empleo, por esta razón, tomo clases de encuadernación y gracias a su hermana quien le consiguió clientes pudo iniciar su actividad desde su casa de encuadernación de libros, trabajos escritos y fotocopias. Con esta labor, puede generar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, con el ánimo de cumplir varios pedidos que tiene, la señora Gloria necesita de la compra de materia prima tal como argollado, pastas de protección para libros y moldes y una estantería para acomodar su trabajo. El sueño de la señora Gloria es tener su propio local y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria worked for many years at a business, which closed not long ago. She has been unemployed since. She took bookbinding classes and started a business from home, offering book and manuscript binding and photocopying services. Her sister helps her get new customers. The income from this business is enough to support Gloria and her two children, ages 17 and 14. 

In order to complete several orders, Gloria needs supplies such as spiral binding, laminated covers and a bookshelf to organize her work. Gloria's dream is to have a separate store location for her business and to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy bookbinding supplies and a bookshelf.

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jesús tiene 60 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y la hija de 23 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Nelson se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura coMo fuente de ingresos de la familia lo que más siembra es maíz, trigo y papas.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en san Miguel . Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes  y pago a los trabajadores. Con la ayudadel crédito ha podido comprar los productos y abonos agrícolas.

El sueño es poder tener la oportunidad de comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es los vientos y las lanchas en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boley.
texts.en:
Nelson Jésus is 60 years old and married with one daughter. He lives with his wife and twenty-three year-old daughter in Ventanas in the Province of Bolívar.

The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crédito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.

Nelson works as a farmer to provide his family with a source of income. He mostly cultivates corn, wheat, and potatoes.

His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel. He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs. With the help of the loan he has been able to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

His dream is to be able to have the opportunity to purchase land. The challenges he faces are the winds and frost in his crops.

In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El Señor Carmelo tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra Demetria, ellos tienen 1 hijo. El es dueño de  una Despensa, su local se encuentra ubicado cerca de una cancha lo que le ayuda a tener buena clientela porque es un lugar muy concurrido especialmente por deportistas que después de jugar se van a comprar bebidas.
Comenta que su esposa siempre lo ayuda en el negocio, ella se encarga de preparar empanadas, milanesas y sándwiches que se venden en la despensa. El sueño que tienen es agrandar su negocio y de esa forma tener un poco más de ganancias para poder, de esa forma, garantizarle un mejor futuro a su hijo, el cual es el motivo de lucha de ellos.
Acude a la Fundación para la compra de bebidas como vinos finos, sidras, gaseosas, golosinas y cervezas, de esa forma va a poder seguir ofreciendo a su clientela productos variados y a buen precio, de esa forma seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmelo is twenty-eight years old and is married to Demetria. They have one child. He owns a grocery store that is located near a ball field, which helps him have many customers since athletes usually frequent his store to purchase drinks after playing sports.
He says that his wife always helps him with his business. She prepares empanadas, milanesas [schnitzel-style breaded fried meat], and sandwiches which they sell in the store. Their dream is to increase their business, and in this way earn more profits so as to be able to guarantee their son a better future. This is what motivates their efforts.
He has turned to the Fundación to purchase drinks such as dry wines, cider, soda pop, sweets, and beer. In this way he will be able to continue offering his customers a variety of products at a fair price, which will allow him to continue improving his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Janet Kaniki

texts.en: Janet, 31 years old, is a single woman. She has no children yet.  For the past one year, she has been selling mobile phones, phone accessories, and providing phone charging services.  In addition, she is employed as a Safaricom agent. Sometimes in her business she faces a challenge of delayed operation from the Safaricom company when doing money transactions. She will use the loan KES 20,000 to purchase phone accessories.   Janet's hopes and dreams is to run several similar stores in the next five years.

loans.use: buy phone accessories

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Ángel Miguel tiene 53 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 29, 23, 21, 19 y 13 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Ángel se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura para mantener a mi familia lo que más produce es el maíz y el trigo.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel y el choclo en la comunidad.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura y comprar semillas, abonos, urea, líquidos para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito ha podido comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar como las semillas, abonos agrícolas.
El sueño es poder comprar terreno y que los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales.
El desafío que se le ha presentado es la lancha y los fuertes vientos que dañan el cultivo de maíz.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con la familia las festividades del Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Ángel Miguel is 53 years old, married with five children, and lives with his wife and children in  San Miguel in the Province of Bolívar. His children are twenty-nine, twenty-three, twenty-one, nineteen, and thirteen years old.

The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crédito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.

Ángel works as a farmer to provide for his family. He grows mostly corn and wheat.

His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel, while he raises the corn in his community.

He is requesting the loan for agricultural purposes – to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.

With the help of the loan, he has been able to purchase the seeds and fertilizers necessary to be able to plant his crops.
His dream is to be able to purchase land, and that his children complete their studies and have professions.
The frost and strong winds that damage his corn crops are the challenges he faces.
In his free time he likes to take walks with his family during the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: for agricultural purposes – to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 51 años de edad es casada  no tiene hijos, vive con el esposo en san Miguel provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Luz se dedica a los trabajos del campo y a los quehaceres de la casa, lo que más siembra es maíz, habas, `para vender y también en poca cantidad para consumo de la casa.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos los hace en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en la agricultura en las compras de semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos para la maleza y para  poder invertir en los estudios de los hijos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las semillas y abonos agrícolas sin ningún tipo xde problema.
El sueño es poder comprar terrenos para poder sembrar y no estar pagando arriendo.

El desafío que se le ha presentado es la sequedad la falta de agua para los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta celebrar las fiestas del divino niño.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 51, is married and has no children.  She lives with her husband in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.  Her communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" which is the name of her community.  It is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton and agriculture is the source of income for the family.

Luz works in the field and takes care of the household.  She grows corn and lima beans to sell and to use for home consumption.  She buys and sells in San Miguel.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her agriculture business and plans to buy seeds, fertilizer and weed killer so she can pay for her childrens' education.

The loan will allow her to buy seeds and fertilizer without any problem.  Her dream is to buy cropland so she does not have to rent land.  Her greatest challenge is lack of water for the crops due to drought.

In her free time she enjoys celebrating the "Fiestas del Divino Niño" (Divine Child Festivities).

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and weed killer.

loans.name: Efrain Leonardo

texts.es:
Efraín Leonardo tiene 41 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 17, 10,8,6 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Efrain se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura para mantener a la familia lo que más siembra es el maíz, trigo y cebada.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura  y comprar de abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y pago de peones.

 Con la ayuda del crédito pudo comprar lo necesario para la siembra del maíz los abonos, y los líquidos.
El seño es poder construir una casa no importa que sea pequeña pero en san Miguel

El desafíos que se le ha presentado son los vientos y la falta de agua.

En el tiempo libre que es el domingo le gusta jugar el boly y disfrutar de  las festividades del carnaval y Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Efraín Leonardo, 41, is married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 17, 10, 8 and 6 in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" after the name of the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton.  Agriculture is the source of income for the family.

Efraín works in agriculture to support his family and his main crops are corn, wheat and barley.  He buys and sells in San Miguel.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and insecticides and to hire workers.  The loan will allow him to buy all he needs for his corn crop, such as fertilizer and other liquids.  

His dream is to build a house in San Miguel, even if it is a small one.

The challenges he is up against are winds and drought.

In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball on Sundays and he also likes the "Divino Niño" festivities and carnival.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, urea, insecticides and to hire workers.

loans.name: Alvaro Marcelo

texts.es:
Alvaro Marcelo tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive solo en san Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Álvaro se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura como fuente de ingresos lo que más produce es el maíz.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, semillas, insecticidas, líquidos para la maleza y poder culminar los estudios.

El sueño es poder culminar los estudios y llegar hacer profesional para poder trabajar.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Alvaro Marcelo is 21, single and has no children.  He lives alone in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank "Yagui Chico" is named after the community which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton and the members have agriculture as their source of income for the families.

Alvaro earns a living through agriculture and grows corn mainly.  He buys and sells in San Miguel.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides and weed killer, as well as to finish his education.  His dream is to finish his studies and become a professional so he can get a job.

He has not had any problem of any kind.  In his free time he enjoys going out and being active in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and weed killer, and to finish his education.

loans.name: Libia Omaira

texts.es: La señora Libia es propietaria de una pequeña tienda adecuada en la sala de su casa y con la cual inicio hace 8 años con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y estar al lado de su hijo. Esta tienda le brinda a la señora Libia los ingresos mínimos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su hijo, la señora Libia necesita de la compra de surtido de licor y abarrotes para mejorar los productos ofrecidos y el servicio a sus clientes. El sueño de la señora Libia es ampliar su negocio y brindarle a su hijo lo mejor en educación, vivienda y salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Libia owns a small store that she runs out of her living room.  She started the business in an effort to improve her income while taking care of her son.  The store gives Libia the minimum resources necessary to maintain the household.  

In an effort to increase sales and improve her son's lifestyle, Libia needs to buy a variety of liquors and groceries to improve her product range and customer service.  Her dream is to expand business and giver her son a better education, environment and wellness.

loans.use: To buy a variety of liquors and groceries.

loans.name: Lydia Susan

texts.en: Lydia, 32 years old, is married and has a two-year-old son. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She runs a retail store and sells detergents, cooking fat, sugar, rice, etc.  She has been involved in this business for two years.  Lydia faces a challenge of insufficient funds for expanding her business.  She will be using the loan KES 20,000 to buy two bags of rice, one bag of sugar, and five cartons of cooking fat.  Her hopes and dreams for the next five years is to run a supermarket.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
Manuel Francisco tiene 31 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 5 y 9 años de edad en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura  como fuente de ingresos de la familia lo que más siembra es el maíz.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel. Solicita el crédito para trabajar en el campo y poder comprar los abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes, líquidos, urea y las semillas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos sin ningún tipo de problema. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Manuel Francisco, 31, is married and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children, ages 5 and 9, in San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

His communal bank is called "Yagui Chico" after the community it is in which is 20 minutes from the San Miguel Canton.  Here most people are involved in agriculture as a source of income for their families.

Manuel grows crops for a living with corn being his main crop.  He buys and sells in San Miguel.  He is requesting a loan to work in the fields and buy fertilizers, liquids, urea and seeds.

The loan will allow him to buy the fertilizers without any problem.  He has had no difficulties so far.  In his free time he enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, liquids, urea and seeds.

loans.name: Fausena

texts.en: On the table seen above, Fausena  has some watermelons displayed on it. She sells different kinds of fruits at Ayensudu near Elmina.  She is married and has 3 children. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Osse-Ni Group
